Text.val: Author: Stephan Huppertz
16.04.2014 SH SCR18364 Added module to create dummy SBUY rows for participants to achieve offload/reload of participation data;
added also status displays if BSF200 is performed online
-- Set variables, used for debug purposes and to add infos to job log

ExpSyntax.val: 'Total number of tables to be offloaded'&' '&Trim(Str({0,1},'9'))

Text.val: -- In case of big tables (e.g. CLNT), we cannot pass the whole Create statement through
gateway/easycom because of 32kB limitation of parameter (max. size 32kB of statement in DB SQL box)
So remaining fields are added separately via Alter tabel/Add column
.. in case of very big tables (for the future) a second part with Alter table/Add column cycles
is performed
... determine nullable column
... determine default value
-- Create statement, until size of 30kB else continue with Alter table/Add Column
(Easycom gateway only supports parameters <= 32kB, so for big tables remaining)
columns which cannnot be within the Create statement have to be added with separate Add column
statements, DB files with max. 90000 characters are supported)
-- 1. Alter table/ Add column block, untile size of 30 kB
-- 2. Alter table/ Add column block, untile size of 30 kB
... remove trailing comma from last column
-- Insert/Update statements
... replace variables %1 = FLPROD %2 = FLUATSAVE
-- In case of big tables (e.g. CLNT), we cannot pass the whole Insert statement through
gateway/easycom because of 32kB limitation of parameter (max. size 32kB of statement in DB SQL box)
So remaining fields are updated separately via Update statement
.. in case of very big tables (for the future) a second part with Update statement cycles
is performed
-- Make sure if at least one buyer is defined for offload/reload, that all buyers related to the programme (SCFP level)
are defined for offload/reload
-- Add dummy buyers (SBUY rows) fro SCPC_TYPE = 2,3,4
-- Create Insert statement, until size of 15kB (= 30 kB) )else continue with Update statement
(Easycom gateway only supports parameters <= 32kB, so for big tables remaining)
columns which cannnot be set via Insert statement have to be updated with separate Update
-- 1. Block to define columns for Update statement block, untile size of 15 kB
-- 2. Block to define columns for Update statement block
